intro: Centropogon gleasonii, commonly known as the Florida flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Centropogon gleasonii plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
